title: Orion Star Tuition Centre marketing website (frontend)

requirements.summary: Build a responsive multi-section homepage that prominently communicates the tuition centre name and Class 1–12 coverage.
acceptanceCriteria: Homepage displays the exact name “Orion Star Tuition Centre”.
Homepage explicitly states that the centre teaches Class 1 through Class 12.
Layout is usable on mobile and desktop (responsive).

file_operations.description: Create the main app view as a responsive multi-section marketing page and ensure the exact text “Orion Star Tuition Centre” and explicit “Class 1 to Class 12” coverage appear prominently in the hero area.
Ensure the app mounts the newly created App component and that global providers remain intact for data fetching and identity (no new auth requirements added for the public homepage).

requirements.summary: Add core homepage content sections with clear English copy and a prominent contact CTA that directs users to the enquiry area.
acceptanceCriteria: Classes/Subjects section clearly covers Class 1–12 using grouped categories.
There is at least one prominent CTA button (e.g., “Enquire Now”) visible in the hero area.
All user-facing text is in English.

file_operations.description: Implement the required content sections (Hero, About/Why Choose Us, Classes & Subjects grouped for Class 1–5, 6–8, 9–10, 11–12, Teaching approach, and a CTA that scrolls/jumps to Contact/Enquiry). Use shadcn-ui components (e.g., Button/Card) for consistent section layout; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a dedicated section component that renders grouped Classes & Subjects for Class 1–5, 6–8, 9–10, and 11–12 in clear English, using shadcn-ui Card typography where appropriate; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a Teaching approach section component with clear English copy and consistent styling (composition-only; no edits to frontend/src/components/ui); verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add a Contact/Enquiry section with a validated form, clear success/failure UI, and submission to the backend so enquiries persist.
acceptanceCriteria: Form validates required fields before submission and shows inline errors.
Successful submission shows a confirmation message and clears the form.
Submitted enquiries are stored in the canister and remain available after page reload.

file_operations.description: Create the enquiry form UI with fields: student name, parent/guardian name, class/grade, phone/email, and message; implement client-side validation with inline errors plus clear success/failure states. Compose shadcn-ui form primitives (Input/Textarea/Button/Alert) without modifying frontend/src/components/ui; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add a React Query mutation hook that calls the backend capability submitEnquiry(...) via useActor, handles errors gracefully, and returns status flags for success/failure rendering.
Wire the Contact/Enquiry section into the homepage and connect the hero CTA (e.g., “Enquire Now”) to navigate/scroll to the enquiry section so users can reach the form quickly.

requirements.summary: Create a simple admin view (not linked in public navigation) to list enquiries (most recent first) and delete an enquiry.
acceptanceCriteria: Admin view displays a list of enquiries including class/grade and contact info fields provided.
Delete action removes an enquiry from storage and it no longer appears after refresh.

file_operations.description: Create an admin-only page that fetches and displays enquiries most-recent-first (including submitted fields and timestamp) and provides a per-item delete action. Use shadcn-ui components (Card/Button/Alert/Dialog) for consistent UI; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add React Query hooks for admin actions: fetch enquiries (getAllEnquiries or paginated capabilities), fetch count if needed, and deleteEnquiry; invalidate/refetch queries after deletions.

Add a small guard component that checks Internet Identity authentication state and calls backend capability isCallerAdmin() to protect the admin view; show an access denied state when unauthorized. Use the authorization component patterns for role-based access control; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add a login/logout button component using the existing Internet Identity hook so admins can authenticate when visiting the admin route. Implement cache-clearing on logout with React Query (per authorization component guidance); verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wire the admin view into the app routing (e.g., /admin) without adding any public navigation links to it; wrap the route in AdminGuard so only admins can access it.

requirements.summary: Apply a coherent, creative, education-appropriate visual theme consistently across the site (avoid blue/purple-dominant styling).
acceptanceCriteria: Theme is consistent across all sections (buttons, headings, cards, backgrounds).
The primary look is not blue/purple-dominant.

file_operations.description: Define global theme tokens and base typography/spacing using a warm, academic palette (e.g., amber/emerald/neutral) that is not blue/purple-dominant, ensuring consistent section, card, and button styling across the site.
Adjust Tailwind theme extensions (as needed) to support the chosen warm, education-appropriate palette and consistent typography scale, aligning with CSS variables used by the app.
Apply consistent layout primitives (container widths, section spacing, heading styles, button variants) across all homepage sections so the site reads as one cohesive theme.

requirements.summary: Include required generated static images in frontend/public/assets/generated and render them in the UI without using the backend for images.
acceptanceCriteria: All required generated images exist under frontend/public/assets/generated.
Homepage visibly uses the generated logo and hero image.

file_operations.description: Add the generated logo asset file at the exact path frontend/public/assets/generated/orion-star-logo.dim_512x512.png.
Add the generated hero banner asset file at the exact path frontend/public/assets/generated/orion-star-hero.dim_1600x600.png.
Add the generated icons set asset file at the exact path frontend/public/assets/generated/orion-star-icons-set.dim_512x512.png.

Render the generated images in the UI: use frontend/public/assets/generated/orion-star-logo.dim_512x512.png in the header/hero branding, frontend/public/assets/generated/orion-star-hero.dim_1600x600.png in the hero section, and incorporate frontend/public/assets/generated/orion-star-icons-set.dim_512x512.png within feature/benefit highlights.
